p:
Although previous reports have shown that CD137 is expressed on human γδ-T cells,
37 direct comparison of the effector functions of CD137 + and CD137 − Vγ9Vδ2-T cell fractions has not been performed. Here, we found that CD137 + Vγ9Vδ2-T cells displayed more potent antiviral activity than their CD137 − counterparts in vitro and in vivo. The cytolytic phenotype of CD137 + effector Vγ9Vδ2-T cells suggests that CD137 may be a marker of potent effector Vγ9Vδ2-T cells (Fig. 2). Using CD137 + Vγ9Vδ2-T cells for adoptive cell-based therapy for influenza is superior to using CD137 − or whole Vγ9Vδ2-T cells (Fig. 3). These properties make adoptive transfer of CD137 + Vγ9Vδ2-T cells an attractive agent for the therapy of influenza diseases.
